Reviews.Title: “Good location to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mjk101
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel on a side street in the Aksaray district. Convenient for the tram and metro. You are about 15 minutes walk from Sultanahmet, where you'll find the Blue Mosque, Cistern and Haga Sophia. The Grand Bazaar is about a ten minutes walk. The hotel is clean and staff helpful. The breakfast was good and rooms like any other 3-4 star hotel. Happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful street, good quality”
Reviews.Author: Sininenpilvi
Reviews.Content: A pretty typical four-star big city hotel. Location on a small quiet street, walking distance from the Grand Bazaar, university, one of the big mosques and other places of interest. One of the main tram lines goes really close and will take you to Sultanahmet and close to Taksim Square where the action is. It was the coldest week of the year (down to -2C and snow) and the heating worked great which was a big plus. The wifi was free and reasonable speed (one of our criteria for choosing it). Walls were really thin so we were glad our neighbours didn't stay up too late! We booked through a travel agent which informed us that transport for airport was included which it wasn't. It was available from the hotel for 25â‚¬ for two but we went for Backpackers Travel instead which was cheaper and great. We took public transport back to the airport and it worked great and was cheap (4L each with a travel card, Istanbulkart).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MIRJANALADJEVAC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime location near the main street of the old part of Istanbul. Hole hotel is small but very tastefully furnished and has a pleasant and calming. Staff at reception was polite within the limits of anything much. Our room was not a surprise, we saw everything on the net. Since I was with his wife expecting a double bed but we got two separate.. That made me very angry, and after the intervention were promised that we will try to find a better day tomorrow room. The hotel has two sides and look at the street, which is some pleasant or apartment block which is not pleasant to the eye. I remark that I presented. I have not intervened the next day because I was very busy but the hotel staff did not even bother to offer me another room. Our room was number 405 and I do not recommend it. Rooms are small but tastefully furnished with clean linen and a decent bathroom. Towels in the bathroom are pretty worn out and I think it's time to replace them. I was very confused to be safe in the room with the key opens the card ... and what is that safe ????? Fortunately we had no problems. The hotel is generally very clean regardless of the wear of carpets ... Breakfast was decent, something for everyone but it certainly does not correspond to a four star hotel. One little things mean a lot but if you travel in the afternoon or evening, the hotel has a reserved, guarded and free space for your luggage to the airport of departure or whatever ... What I was particularly fascinated helt center that owns the hotel. I suggest everyone to afford a suite, sauna, Turkish bath and massage oil. Employees are vliki maistore in his work and every praise. Packer costs 50 euros and believe me it is worth every euro. Once again pozivcija hotel is fantastic and all the sights in the old part of town can be visited on foot or by tram spear in three minutes from the hotel or the metro, which is 10 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average but central & clean”
Reviews.Author: fareed21
Reviews.Content: What made us book this hotel was the location, the free transfers from & to the airport, a tour to the spice marketr & a hald day Bosphorus cruise.THe hotel was conveniently located near the main tourist spots such as the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia & the museum. It was located in the wholesale shopping area, whichmade it very easy for my wife & daughter to shop. The hotel was clean, the bathroom was large & well appointed. They gave us adjoining interleading room which was a bonus as we had two grandsons travelling with us. Overeall we had a lovely time & Istanbul was great & we would return anytime

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: john c
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, a stone throw away from the old town city centre. Hotel pick up service from the airport was excellent and value for money. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a bit small and had no views.Hotel offered a variety of tours which though reasonably priced we did not avail ourselves of as we had already booked a private tour. All round a fairly good hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: danandrei
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, in the city centre, close to metro and tourist attractions. It's a standard 4 * hotel regarding the services. The staff is very polite and willing to help. I could get the room before 2pm when it's check-in time. There is free wireless Internet available. The price is not low (80Euro room/night). If you intend to use the metro you should check how you can get from metro to the hotel. It's not very easy. Metro is 700m away from the hotel. You can get very easy from the airport (Ataturk) to the hotel using the metro. In Istanbul a GPS is required. The city is like a labyrinth.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and the unsafest safetybox I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: 33tu
Reviews.Content: We got a very tiny double room. There was 15 cm space between bed and and the tv-table. It was difficult to go round the bed and each other and topack and unpack in such a limmited space. We paid a reasonable price, but it was not told that the room smalller than normal. I would never expect this kind of room in a4-star hotel. There was a safety-box in room, free of charge, But there was no securyty code but the box was opend by the room key card. Would you put your valuables in a box that the cleaners have access to. In addition to that the number of the room was printed on the key card, should you drop it, the finder knows where to head to. As the same key card was needed to have electricuty to the room. So, when you wanted to open the safe, you had to do it in darkness. We like hard beds but this was too hard. Even the pillow were like stone, we had headache every morning. The lady in the reception was unfriendly, almost aggresive, when we asked quiestions, and somebody else wanted to book tour. Free wifi but bad connection. We didn't succeed in checking-in for the return flight. The public areas of the hotel were of much better quality than the room. The breakfast was good, too. The location was not that good. Thre was 400 m to closest tram stop and 20 minute walk to the grand bazar. There were shops and hotels in the area, but no restaurants or bars execpt in the hotels. Knowing this, I would rather stay closer to the tourist areas with restaurants and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - "Avoidable Front Office"”
Reviews.Author: Vikmal68
Reviews.Content: We choose the Hotel for its location and services which it propmised. Must say lived up to all the promises - such as free pick and drop from Airport , 1/2 City tour, fruits basket, welcome drinks etc. In fact good localle at very reasonable price. The only thing which was annowing was the pushy nature of Front Office Executives to sell us local sight seeing packages. On non acceptance, you could see the frustration and irritation on their faces. The tone changed from polite to harsh & we got the feeling of "UNWANTED" at the time of check in & did put us off....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and we recommend”
Reviews.Author: najeebuu
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel its location and services. Restaurant was also fine. The hotel promised some special offers and they fulfilled those promises. We like to be back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you might expect in a very central location and for a surprisingly reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Writer_from_Riga Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect service, for a very brief stay (for conference) the hotel leaves nothing more to wish for. The room was surprisingly large as well as the bathroom (considering the very reasonable price!), breakfast buffet offered everything you expect, and the staff was helpful and professional. Would recommend for a peaceful night after a busy day. Free wi-fi in the room - essential if you plan to do some work on the go and book tickets etc. Location is suitable for exploring most of the sights by foot, and the Aksaray metro stop is a brief walk away (and from there you can take a direct metro line that takes you to the airport that I found very convenient for a traveler with no luggage). I would definitely choose the hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ashok M
Reviews.Content: WE stayed in this hotel for 3 days . We found the hotel through trip advisor and got an excellent deal by directly booking with the hotel. Deal included half day tour ( Bosphourus cruise). Hotel is located in commercial area with lot of shops dealing in textile. It is close to public transport. Nearest metro station is about 15 minutes walk. Hotel rooms are slightly small. Bathroom whas a turkish bath ( Half tub with a seat). Another freind of ours has a room with regular tub. Minifridge and LCD TV is provided.Toiletaries is adequate however room does not have a coffee maker. Breakfast was included in the deal. Breakfast has number of dishes and vegetarians have adequate choice. Restaurent for Lunch and Dinner has a limited meny with very reasonable prices. As we were vegetarian waiter went out of way to organise vegetarian dishes for one Lunch and dinner we ate at the Restaurent. Most surprising was Turkish tea at lobby bar which cost us only 1 Euro, while street price is about 1.5 euro. In the evening on the road side a night bazar get organised. Overall excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “This hotel delivers all it promises - we had a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jynon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 nights at the Yigitalp and felt well cared for the entire time. The reception/desk staff is professional, the room was very clean, maid service was prompt and efficient; the restaurant staff was incredible; friendly, well organized, kept everything well stocked on the breakfast buffet and the food was excellent. We ate breakfast every morning from the buffet and had a wide variety in which to choose; we dined in the hotel restaurant on three occasions and each meal was above average. The hotel location is ideal, as the tram is a mere 5 minute walk from the hotel and Sultanahmet is about an 8 minute tram ride. The Turkish bath, sauna and massage area in the hotel is top-notch and something we would highly recommend. It was very clean and once again, the staff was professional and couldn't have been more kind. We were given a Bosphorous tour, compliments of the hotel, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. As an extra excursion, we booked tickets through the hotel to see a service of Whirling Dervishes and the performance met my expectations, while my husband was a little less impressed, though glad to have had the experience. Initially, we were sceptical about booking this hotel, because the price was so reasonable and because the location isn't in the heart of the tourist area. The hotel is located in the district of "Lalali", in the Bazaar quarter, but the immediate area surrounding Yigitalp is a commercial business zone and while it's quite busy during the day, the evenings become quiet as the businesses close. We considered this a plus, as we were allowed nights of uniterrupted sleep. Also, I had my hair cut in the hotel salon and again, the service was impressive, the rates comparable to what I would pay at home and I loved the cut. I really can't say anything negative about our hotel stay, it was a pleasant surprise. After a long day of site seeing, it was always so nice to get back to our clean home away from home in the evening. This was our first trip to Istanbul and we had an incredible time. On our next visit, we won't scour the internet as we did before, we'll just book another stay at the Yigitalp.

Reviews.Title: “so comfortable hotel and good location , i liked it ...”
Reviews.Author: naghmeh126
Reviews.Content: very clean and comfortable and cozy rooms , great services , good location , very polite and friendly crew , great breakfast , i loved their orange juice and coffee , we stayed 6days there and we enjoyed it ...

Reviews.Title: “Good but hot”
Reviews.Author: vday1962
Reviews.Content: Good food excellent starting point to visit old city by tram or on foot Climate control sucks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip4646
Reviews.Content: I booked Yigitalp hotel on-line for 3 nights stay. At Ataturk airport the hotel driver was waiting with my name tag and assisted me to his vehicle. On arrival at the hotel the courteous hotel staff received me as if they have known me for a long time which made me feel at home among friends right away. My stay at this great hotel was as comfortable as it gets. The staffs were extremely friendly and always ready to help. The front office was very resourceful in answering all my questions. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a quite clean place to stay. I loved the Country which means I will go back for a visit soon and obviously I intend to stay at Yigitalp again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for off-season price”
Reviews.Author: Taski63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Yigitalp Hotel with my wife 4 nights at Christmas 2010. We had a great offer via hotels.com, and read the good reviews here in tripadvisor. The hotel proved to be as good as we expected! Service was polite, swift and friendly. There wasn't a single person in the staff that didn't greet us with a smile. Room was smallish, but very clean and nice. Beautiful details in decoration. Bathroom was also clean, with modern eqipment. Bed was good and firm, very good for my back. The room was very warm, possibly because I did'n even try to adjust the ac control panel; as smokers, we kept the window open most of the time. In spite of that there was no noise (except the mosque prayer call after 6 am). The breakfast was very good, with interesting variety of cheeses and pretty good coffee, and delicious fruits. Breakfast room was also nice looking and very clean. All the ingredients appear to be very fresh. The room service was good and fast, and the prices were reasonable. Free wifi-connection was sometimes slow, but it worked every time. The location was good, about five minutes walk to tram stop T1 and only a few stops away from the Sultanahmet area (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service at the Yigitalp”
Reviews.Author: AJR61
Reviews.Content: I booked the Yigitalp a long time ago for our stay for three nights. Unfortunately, they had a problem with their database and a lot of bookings were lost. However, because I e-mailed them prior to our stay they were wonderful! They arranged for us to stay at another hotel (Darkhill) for one night and we were then moved very swiftly to Yigitalp the next day without any inconvenience. The staff were courteous and extremely apologetic for the mishap. The room we shared was airy and very clean and the Yigitalp is in a fantastic location - near to all the main sights in Sultanahmet. Cannot recommened it highly enough and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Yigitalp - strange name, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: YourMumRang
Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable hotel, with friendly staff and good service. Hotel was well situated for the major tourist attractions - which could be accessed on foot or via a short cab ride. The hotl itself was better than average, but not spectacular. A good base for exploring all the fascinating sites, but you wouldn't feel the need to stay in the hotel for a great deal of time. Nice bar area in the lobby, with a friendly waiter. Breakfast pretty good. All in all, a solid, clean & friendly hotel - just not incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxineJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Staff were efficient and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The rooms are also very soundproof - no traffic noise or selfish hotel guests will keep you awake at night. This was a super hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to go back on our next stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sal009
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel, the room we were assigned was very crammed so they showed us a couple of alternatives. The room we chose was at the back of the hotel with a nice view, very roomy. The whole hotel is extremely clean and well maintained. The staff are very helpful and we really could not have asked for more. We only had breakfasts at the hotel which was very good. The hotel is in a great location for all the main sites in Istanbul which was great. We will definately be going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Zeyn-Dawood
Reviews.Content: Booking online for the first time was my fear that what i book i might not get, but Hotel Yigitalp in Istanbul Turkey changed my perception of online booking. I received a speedy response with regards to my bookings and all questions asked with regards to location. Upon arrival at the airport a shuttle was waiting for myself & my family. We were checked into the Hotel without any waiting on arrival to the Hotel and received exactly what we requested. The service is of it's highest standard. YES, I will use Hotel Yigitalp and with refer friends to use this Hotel. It's location to all the tourist sites is most convenient. Rooms are small like all European Countries, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, neither good nor bad”
Reviews.Author: GreenBeans2010
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious. Bed was not comfortable. Staff at the front desk was not super friendly and tried to sell us tours that we didn't need and send us to a carpet shop for commission purposes. Breakfast was good and location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good, smart hotel, ideal for solo or group travellers”
Reviews.Author: oman54
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Ataturk Airport in the afternoon and was met by a driver with my name on a card. Airport transfers are free if you book directly, online, with the hotel. After 30 minutes, I arrived at the hotel and paid cash up front, receiving a 5% discount for doing this. You can pay by card if you want to, but 5% is 5% after all. I was given a voucher for a free 1/2 day river tour, free dinner voucher - when you've used it just ask for another and they give it to you. There is a lift to the room which was very nice. There's a flat screen television, minibar - regularly stocked, a large bowl of fresh fruit and a welcoming cocktail. Within the hotel there is a reasturant, good bar, a leisure suite i.e. turkish bath etc. There are flat screen TVs in the general lounge but they don't dominate. The hotel is within walking distance of the Hagia Sofia and only 15 minutes from the Grand Bazzar. Altogether a good, safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Stay in Yigitalp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayCrazyBerlin
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel . Staff were proffesional. Breakfast was good and fresh, They served Chocolate and Fresh Orange Juice to our Child every morning free of charge.Very close to Metro and all Histircal Paleces. good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Pinocchibu Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: very good location and good walking distance to the grand bazaar. Located in a little street off the buzz, the area has decent selection of food places opened til late and the overall environment of hotel is decent for the price given. Istayed in the connected room which was superb. Service was also satisfactory. There is space to improve for the amount of toiletries available in the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Below standard - Soulless- Dishonest Staff but CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Gypsteve
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A 3 STAR HOTEL. Arriving at the hotel, the guy at the front desk demands cash instead of credit card for a discount. Upon refusal, he gave us attitude and was most unhelpful throughout the 9 day stay. He told us that there are no restaurants or cafe around the hotel. We discovered otherwise once we started to walk around. Great location for this side of the Bosphorous but a little far from Istikal street - the main touristy thoroughfare and the Galata bridge. However, close to the Tram (once you discover it) and it can take you to the different Baazar and mosques etc. The rooms, although not airy, were always clean and well kept and clean. DO NOT EAT IN THE RESTAURANT in this hotel. It is the worst food you would undoubtedly find in your culinary experience. It does not even have a remote semblance to food. The Breakfast was ok for a standard continental breakfast. The rooms are really small and if you are located at the front of the hotel, the noise on the street can be annoying. I still cannot get over how unfriendly the staff was. Maybe it is cultural, who knows..

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: claudia40
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful vacation. Advise anyone to try this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel-excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: aggeliki
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel from 31/10 to 5/11 and everything was great. The room was very clean (a little bit small) but very warm and cosy. The breakfast was great-with big variety. The hotel and the staff were very polite and helpful. book your stay through internet. You have a cruise as a gift

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprising”
Reviews.Author: unclestan
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel throughout. Staff were proffesional and non intrusive. Breakfast was varied and fresh, so you don't have to eat the same thing every morning,if you so choose. 7 minute walk to tram station, 30 minutes walk to Sultanhamet attractions, same to the waterside.15 minutes to the Carsi Kapli. On the whole, good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Soulless Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BRYNSI
Reviews.Content: Located within a short walk to the Grand Bazaar, this was a good hotel for its situation. The hotel accommodation was satisfactory with all the usual amenities, although the hotel lobby/coffee lounge was soulless and felt like being in a library, wishing you had remained out in the city for a relaxation, the staff however were attentive. Breakfast consisted of both hot and cold buffet and was better than most hotel breakfasts we have experienced, the only downside, was the restaurant was in the basement, with neither views nor windows. Our room was on the top floor, we took the lift as far as it went, then had to climb the stairs to the last floor. Our room was in the eves and not suitable for somebody over six foot in height, which I am. The views from the bedroom window were breath taking, once you stood on a chair and reached the window sill. We made the mistake of leaving the window slightly open one evening, only to find that the rain poured in, luckily it damaged nothing of ours, but did pour over the hotel's badly positioned television set. If going to Istanbul for good restaurants and nightlife, I would pick a hotel in the Takism area, which comes to life at night with plenty to do, If you only want the sights and an early night this hotel is perfect. Area is very safe and a pleasure to walk in and is very handy for all transport, and the train to and from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: alsilverfox
Reviews.Content: This hotel Is Ideal for Itsl location About 5 minuteswalk to the tram stop were you can get the tram to visit all the sights within a10 minute tram ride without having to change trams the hotel was spotless and all the staff were very pleasant if you book direct with the hotel they send up to your room a basket of fruit and complimantry drinks and also they give you a free excursion plus they pick you up from and take you back to the airport

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: haqqaani
Reviews.Content: i went to this hotel between the dates 27th april to 3rd may 2009. i booked a room for three of us. we had two single beds and an extra matress. i paid Â£84.00p for the room per night for three of us. i stayed in room 111. taxi from the aiport is about 15-20 minutes drive, costing around 25 turkish leira (TL). which is around Â£13, this depends on the time you travel. like in the uk taxi tariffs change. in turkey after 11pm and before 6am...i think this hotel is located 10 minutes walking distance from the grand bazaar and about 20 minutes from the blue mosque, haga sophia, topkapi palace. my advice if your going to travel in a taxi, then always get the taxi driver to put on the cab-meter. if the taxi driver is not prepared to use his meter then there are plenty that will do. its cheaper this way. turkish people are happy to rip you off. haga sopia, blue mosque, and the topkapi palace are located together. a taxi from yigitalp to here is around 6 turkish leira. the spice bazaar is around 10 minute walk from the blue mosque. do not use the excursion deals to these places. i paid 105 euros to see these places when i can have done it for half the price and half the time. yigitalp hotel: was excellent. very clean, very efficient. it is as the photos show. the staff are polite and very helpfull. the bath rooms and rooms are cleaned every day. the bathroom was excellent, the shower was brilliant. with instant hot water. we asked for an iron, it appeared within minutes of our call. one major down fall, the staff, other than the ones in reception, dont speak english. so when you ring housekeepiing, room service its like talking to a brick wall. i truly felt like at home at this hotel. and for the price i paid i would recommend it to my british friends. there is an internet room, which u can use for 1 euro for half an hour.there is spa room on the bottom floor. very expensive and not worth the price. you can negotiate the prices i only paid 10 TL for the jacuzzi. however there are plenty of hotels in the very heart of the old city. which is around the blue mosque, haga sophia. yigitalp is atleast 20-30 minute walk from there, a touch far really. beacuase on a night we had to taxi it to the blue mosque for a bit of night life, reatuarants, etc. if i went back i would definately go back to this hotel, but i would prefer to be alot closer to the blue mosque area of the old city. everything is near by and better night life. i hope that helps folks. happy hols

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nilli
Reviews.Content: Any one planning to go to Istanbul must stay at Yigitalp.very comfortable place.the staff is so kind and helpful.i stayed there for 7 nights and my experience was very good.i had no problem at all.i was staying as single.every toursit attraction is at the walking distance the tram way is so near.The breakfast was very good with so much variety and the food at restraunt was very nice also.over all very nice and economical place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: IntlTrainer
Reviews.Content: I am the international trainer for my company and I was looking for a reasonable hotel book a training meeting for customers. I was very happy with my experience. I got the meeting room for an extremely reasonable rate and it came with the projector, screen, sound, white board, etc without extra charge. We received free transfers from the airport, one free dinner, free breakfast, welcome fruit basket and cocktail and a half a day tour. The price again was extremely reasonable for the rooms. My room was adequate size with a mini bar - I like to buy my own snacks and put them in the refrigerator. The bathroom was very clean. The bed was rather hard - I prefer a soft bed. The room was also hot at times so I had to open the window. I didn't have the heater on so that was a little odd. I was on the 5th floor. I sent my laundry out and it came back fine. Not much variety of English TV stations - only the BBC. The hotel has a spa in the basement as well as a beauty salon. Again, everything is clean and reasonable. The breakfast buffet was adequate but if you stay longer than a few days, it could be boring for some people. I was happy with it. I had the free dinner and the food was fine although the service was not so good. The reception desk staff were extremely helpful and very accommodating. No problems with my bill. The local phone calls can be expensive however direct calls to the US were reasonable. The neighborhood is an area of wholesale home textile shops. There are other shops as well but lots of textile shops. The tram is a couple of blocks away and it will take you directly to the tourist area of Sultanamet. The ferry to Bursa is about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: TurkishDreams
Reviews.Content: Once a year we visit Turkey to do buying for our shop in South Africa. This year we decided to go in summer and booked a double room in the Yigitalp Hotel. We stayed there in total for about 3 weeks. The friendly help we received on a continuous basis was amazing. The room was always clean. The food was great. Not like your typical European breakfasts that only consist out of a bun and jam. The variety was great. We had supper 2 nights in the hotel which was lovely. I must recommend this hotel to all. It is wonderfully located. The staff is always too happy to assist with any matter or question. We definitely will be back next year. Riaan le Roux Cape Town South Africa

Reviews.Title: “better than average”
Reviews.Author: trip92
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week from Istanbul and this hotel was our base. Its a nice hotel. although its 4 stars (in the UK it would probably be 3 stars), having said that it many benefits. Positives Its in a good location to explore Istanbul. The tram stop is about 3 mins walk. (trams are cheap and a great way to get around) The Fatih district is 5 mins walk, (many inexpensive restaurants in this district) The Grand Bazaar a 10 min walk. If the weather is fine you can walk to Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque) takes about 20 mins or 3 mins by tram. There are many inexpensive eating kebab places nearby. Sezade mosque is about 1 min away. (its a beautiful mosque) Hotel is clean, reception staff are very helpful. Negatives Its not in most picturesque place (its actually in a commercial wholesale area) but its a clean area. the rooms are a bit on small side Tips I booked via the hotels website, it was cheaper than other sites, they included (in the hotel price) free transfer from and to the airport, a free 4 hour tour of the Istanbul, a fruit basket on arrival plus free drinks on reception. Breakfast was included and was a buffet style.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marymar
Reviews.Content: A friend stayed there and recommended it for its price. The rooms are not the biggest but for the price you pay they're OK. The hotel is just 2 blocks from the metro(tram) stop. The area is not very touristic, but it only takes a 10-minute-ride to get to the main spots. Breakfast is OK. Tip: book directly through the hotel's website, they offer you free pick-up and drop-off and arrival cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Yigitalp..a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: khd5015
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 days at this hotel over Christmas 2007. I found the hotel pleasent, and the staff very helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of the Aksaray tram stop. We used the trams a lot to get around Istanbul. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Fatih Mosque, Istanbul University, the Grand Bazaar and the Shehzade Camii Mosque, as well as to a McDonalds (if that is your kind of thing) as well as some very inexpensive Kebab places. It is also within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, although it is a longish walk. All in all, I would stay here again. I really cannot think of any negatives this hotel had, and I echo all the positive comments made on this site, which I read before visiting Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: unrich
Reviews.Content: overall good. receptionists were pleasant and helpful.decor attractive. rooms small but adequate. breakfast fine.very clean and well maintained. downside; beds could be a little better and cupboard space limited. location not brilliant but better than taksim in our opinion annoying--- 4 lira for 1 hour internet. charge for bringing in own drink and food at one half their bar charge.though how they police it beats me. excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: belmac
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Yigitalp and were very impressed. The photos on website do not do this hotel justice. Rooms were bigger than we expected, breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice, hotel was lovely and clean, all staff very friendly and helpful. Lady on reception had excellent English language skills. Hotel is situated in a good position too for trams which are easy to negotiate to use for getting around. Several tourist sites are within walking distance. Plenty of restaurants nearby although food in them is much the same regardless of price. Beware when visiting Blue Mosque as you exit via a rear door and there is a Turkish man in national costume carrying a large coffee pot who hangs about for you to have your photo taken with him and then rips you off but this was the only bad experience we had. Also go to the port and have a day jumping on and off ferries which is good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alcachi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yigitalp Hotel during one week while we visited Istanbul. It is situated near the Grand Bazaar and there are also a lot of restaurants close to the hotel (near the bridge). Take into account that there are also several exchange offices very close to the hotel so it is better to change there than in the hotel. The room was fine, even if the beds could be a bit softer. The air condition was a bit noisy. The breakfast was great, with fresh fruits and several things to choose depending on what you like. Good hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Riaz_Ali
Reviews.Content: The Yigitalp is a good hotel for someone travelling to Istanbul for a few days. Located in the old city it is very close to all the main tourist sites. The rooms are clean but small. Not much of a view from the hotel. The staff is friendly and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid Istanbul Yigitalp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dolfinmv
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 4 nights in Easter holidays and I had a horrible experience. Myself & my wife went to Istanbul for her birthday and though it would a good idea to stay in a hotel which is central and value for money. They charged EUR75 per night. Though the hotel is categorised as a four star hotel it does not have the standard of even a low end 3 star hotels. The Istanbul Yigitalp Hotel staff especially reception are horrible and very confrontational. We arrived a bit early in the morning and we told that we had prior booking. One of the staff at the reception told us we can only check in after 10:00 am. So we waited in the lounge. By around 10:30 no one even bothered to tell us that a room was ready. But a group of people (about 8) who came after us checked into their rooms before us. At 11:00am I thought I would check with the reception and he said there were rooms available. A bell boy took our luggage to a room. To our disappointment it was a small room with two single beds. We had actually paid and booked a non smoking double bed room a month ago. I rang the manager in the lobby and he said that there were no other rooms. But after I complained he said I can have another room. The bell boy took us to this room and it was small and it stank very badly of smoke. I couldnâ€™t even stand the smell. The manager was so rude and he said that there was no other room so we had to spend the 1st night in the single bed room. The other thing was that even before we checked in the manager tried to sell so many site-seeing tours even though I was not interested in them. The following day we went to the reception and told that we had booked a non smoking double bedroom but we had been given a room with two single beds. Then they tried to cover it up by saying that is was Easter and a busy time and that they will see what they can do for us and that it will be as a favour. They were very confrontational and not apologised to us even once for the inconvenience caused. This is not a four star hotel as it lacks basic tea making facilities, even two star B & Bâ€™s have these facilities. Other facilities in the room did not even match a 3 star category, like there was a loud noise coming from the heater, which needed repair. The staff were not very helpful and they were rude and very unprofessional. Please try to avoid this hotel to prevent any disappointments in your holiday.

HotelInfo.Name: Yigitalp Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 38 Cukur Cesme Sok | Sehzadebasi, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
